revision.text: Possibly: An epitome of natural and experimental philosophy, including geography, with the Use of the globes, and of an improved analemma, By which may be solved the common Problems of the celestial globe. Designed for the use of schools. The Whole, being a proper memorial-book, for Young Ladies or Gentlemen, who attend public Courses; more particularly those of the Author. By Benjamin Donn, master of the mathematical-academy, At Bristol. (Benjamin Donne). (London : Sold by B. Law, in Ave-mary-Lane; and G. Kearsley, Ludgate-Hill, Booksellers. Also by Messrs. Heath and Wing, Instrument-Makers, in the Strand, London; and by the author at Bristol, 1769?) http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2103756~S1
